item.title: Carrie add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "We lay there and looked up at the night sky and she told me about stars called blue squares and red swirls and I told her I'd never heard of them. Of course not, she said, the really important stuff they never tell you. You have to imagine it on your own." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description:
"You may not remember the time you let me go first. Or the time you dropped back to tell me it wasn't that far to go. Or the time you waited at the crossroads for me to catch up. You may not remember any of those, but I do and this is what I have to say to you:
Today, no matter what it takes, we ride home together." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Most people don't know there are angels whose only job is to make sure you don't get too comfortable & fall asleep & miss your life. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Don't you hear it? She asked & I shook my head no & then she started to dance & suddenly there was music everywhere & it went on for a very long time & when I finally found words all I could say was thank you. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "They came to sit & dangle their feet off the edge of the world & after awhile they forgot everything but the good & true things they would do someday. " -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "I have too much to lose, she said, if I cross that line. Like what? I said. She could not think of anything that day so she said she'd get back to me. Since then I've been thinking what I would lose if I cross my line & I haven't come up with anything either. There's always another line somewhere." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Remember to use positive affirmations. I am not a dork is not one of them." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Being a Humanist means trying to behave decently without expectation of rewards or punishment after you are dead." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Where do I get my ideas from? You might as well have asked that of Beethoven. He was goofing around in Germany like everybody else, and all of a sudden this stuff came gushing out of him. It was music. I was goofing around like everybody else in Indiana, and all of a sudden stuff came gushing out. It was disgust with civilization." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "Sometimes I think it is a great mistake to have matter that can think and feel. It complains so. By the same token, though, I suppose that boulders and mountains and moons could be accused of being a little too phlegmatic." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Wake up, you idiots! Whatever made you think that money was so valuable?" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.
item.description: "We're terrible animals. I think that the Earth's immune system is trying to get rid of us, as well it should." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"To be is to do - Socrates
To do is to be - Sartre
Do Be Do Be Do - Sinatra" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I really wonder what gives us the right to wreck this poor planet of ours." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "What should young people do with their lives today? Many things, obviously. But the most daring thing is to create stable communities in which the terrible disease of loneliness can be cured." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "There is no reason why good cannot triumph as often as evil. The triumph of anything is a matter of organization. If there are such things as angels, I hope that they are organized along the lines of the Mafia." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are healthy only to the extent that our ideas are humane." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "- Why me? - That is a very Earthling question to ask, Mr. Pilgrim. Why you? Why us for that matter? Why anything? Because this moment simply is. Have you ever seen bugs trapped in amber? - Yes. - Well, here we are, Mr. Pilgrim, trapped in the amber of this moment. There is no why." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "His response was to fight it with the only weapons at hand—passive resistance and open displays of contempt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.
item.description: "He wanted to talk to them, if he could, to discover whether they had truths about life which he had never heard before. Here is what he hoped new truths might do for him: enable him to laugh at his troubles, to go on living, and to keep out of the North Wing of the Midland County General Hospital, which was for lunatics." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.
